reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quite Possibly The Absolute BEST BUY In Car Audio Of All-Time!!!
reviews.reviewText: Before I start my review of the Sound Storm Labs EX369 6x9 3-way car speakers I would like to say KUDOS to the reviewer who said..."Sounded crisp and clear, anyone who says otherwise either installed wrong or doesn't know what they're talking about." Normally I dismiss a comment like that but something inside me told me that he was right on.At fifteen bucks a pair...what the heck...I pulled the trigger on Amazon Smile. I'm so glad I did! The overall packaging of the product is impressive as are the speakers themselves. Included are eight screws and sheet metal nuts along with a 6x9 template if needed and gorgeous grills plus the two POS & NEG pigtails normally included with car speakers.Before I go any further...let's clearup the specs as they are wrong on many sites. The FREQUENCY RESPONSE is 50Hz to 20KHz + or - 3db. The SENSITIVITY is 92 db. The sound quality when properly installed is such that these specs seem to be accurate...more accurate than competing gear that do not indicate the PLUS or MINUS 3db in their specs. The woofer material is polypropylene NOT paper. The Pioneer 6x9 tri-axes that these replaced seemed to be made of paper as they easily crumbled at the slightest touch over time.I installed these in the rear deck of a '96 Camry LE using a pair of 3/4" mdf black carpeted spacers. Anyone who has had the rather frustrating experience of working on a Toyota rear deck knows that the existing mounting holes are way too recessed for proper tweeter sound. The end result was that I was able to easily access the 6x9s while using the supplied grills which are much better looking I think than the tan Toy ones. I'll post some pics here soon.These are great looking and sounding speakers for the money. You could easily spend up to fifty bucks a pair for competing models by Pioneer, Cerwin-Vega, Boss, JVC, Kenwood and others without getting appreciably better sound. In fact I would say you'd have to spend about $70 for a pair of Rockford Fosgates to do better. The speakers also have a very noticeable break-in period whereas they keep going deeper and opening up during initiation. THEY JUST KEEP SOUNDING MORE AMAZING EVERYDAY!!!Now I've installed car stereos for 45 years ...YES...I'm an old-timer 4 sure...LOL. but never have experienced this quality even remotely close to this price. You actually start to feel the bass while experiencing superb mids and highs...all with just a modest aftermarket radio. The speakers are well-constructed and I see no reason why you cannot run them off a high-powered remote amp but take care to UPGRADE the supplied pigtails to H.D. ones when doing so. Either way...you'll get a well-balanced sounding stereo capable of very good detail.Take care when installing. Just because they are only $15 don't treat 'em like cheap garbage. Take your time and think things out. These would certainly make great gifts for family and friends. KUDOS to Sound Storm Labs for offering such a great product for a reasonable price!!! Go SSL...GOD BLESS and HAPPY LISTENING...LOL...PJSII

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The sound is impressive.
reviews.reviewText: I installed these speakers in the front doors of a 2005 Lexus RX330. Of course, they didn't fit so I had to modify the original speaker bracket and bolt the speaker to it, using the original factory plug.After putting the side panels back together, the speakers sounded amazing. I wasn't expecting the bass that it had, but the mids and highs were impressive. I'm using the stock head unit and original wiring. I would absolutely recommend these speakers to anyone who is replacing the factory speakers in their car.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I know a little about installation of these items so it was not very difficult for me. My issue is that it doesn’t hold amplified sound very well. Over all a good value for the money but you are limited to the volume strength.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars easy to install
reviews.reviewText: replaced old speaker in truck. a soldering gun should be used to place electrical terminal from old to new speakers. sound quality is standard. use in 2003 dodge ram

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great speakers for the cost!
reviews.reviewText: I had some Skar EVL's laying around and I wanted to do something with them. I bought these speakers to compliment the subwoofers for my bluetooth speaker I built for the subwoofers. The speakers being run with a 120hz high pass filter and sound GREAT on a 50 watt per channel amplifier.If you're interested in the toolbox thing, I have 2 12v batteries wired in parallel in the bottom section. I have a balancing RC battery charger that also charges lead acid batteries, Ill be mounting it on the back exterior of the box and hard wiring it too the batteries as a built in charger. (6amp 14v output for $40, literally cannot be beat by any automotive spec charger.) The head unit I pulled out of my car, it's a cheap walmart touch screen. The amp is also an SSL product, the EV4.400, HIGHLY recommend this amplifier. Everything is self contained and 100% portable, as well as solar ready!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Got these to put into our beat up truck that has just a standard in dash stereo no amplifier. Never turned the stereo up loud but even at a max of 45 watts these speakers should have been perfectly fine even if I did. But nope day #2 and one started distorting at low volume. Total garbage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 2005 Dodge ram speakers
reviews.reviewText: Mixed reviews on whether the product would fit my 2005 Dodge ram. Fit perfect, used the factory speaker adapters from the old speakers and had to use a screw driver to pry the last tab on, but fits perfectly. Also, don’t forget to get wiring harness for these. Speakers are factory quality, good enough for me since I’m not trying to blare music up and down the road.

Las compre para reemplazar unas Pioneer TS-A6908 200W lo que le llaman "Old School" con un peso se 2.5 Kg cada una y con un enorme Iman, desgraciadamente despues de 30 años dejaron de sonar con la clarisad que las caracterizaba,Cuando recibi mi nuevo par de bocinas SSL la verdad dude ya que entre las 2 bocinas no alcanzan a pesar 1 kg. y el iman con el que cuentan es una broma comparado con el de las Pioneer.Las instale y para mi sorpresa el sonido es bastante bueno, realmente no creo poder encontrar bocinas con esta calidad de sonido por $650 MX $31 USSi lo que buscas es buen sonido al mas bajo costo esta es una excelente opcion!

Obviamente no son las mejores bocinas, pero si me sorprendió mucho la salida de graves, las monte en un kia río 2017 en sustitución de las bocinas de agencia, y si mejoró por mucho el sonido de agencia, ahora se escucha mucho mejor y mas profundos los bajos o graves, yo las recomiendo para sustitución de las bocinas de agencia sin necesidad de usar amplificadores, ya que conectadas directo al estereo de agencia dan muy buen resultado.
Treble are good but bass aintgood replacement speaker for a pontiac wave 2009

La verdad las compré con pocas expectativas, lo único que quería era cambiar mis bocinas anteriores porque el sol las descompuso y sonaba mal. Y la verdad es que me encanta cómo se escucha, satisfecha con mi compra.
Hasta el momento todo funciona correcto
